menu

Precision Farming

Earth Rover is creating a new farming ecosystem, swarms light-weight autonomous farm vehicles, carrying precision tools and guided by an intellegent data platform.

lightbulb_outline

Data

We use Earth Rover's robots to monitor every plant and to weed, feed and tend crops efficiently and precisely. We gather data from the fields and provide analysis and planning tools to help farmers improve their productivity.

nature_people

Farmers

Earth Rover's open and extensible platform helps farmers control their technology and their farm's data. Earth Rover are committed to using technology to empower farmers the world over.

settings

Robots

Our robots have been designed by robotics engineers from the European Mars Rover programme. Robust, light-weight and energy efficient these robots, with on-board AI and precision tools, open up a new era of farming technology.

Team

James Arthur - Director

James is a software developer and serial technology entrepreneur. Previously co-founder and CTO of Wiki-House and Opendesk.

Luke Robinson - Chief Scientist

Luke has a PhD in Physics for research work in quantum computing from Cambridge University and has held research fellowships at both Cambridge and Oxford Universities

Paul Harter - CTO, Product & Strategy

Paul is a developer and digital toolmaker specialising in robotics, open hardware and digital manufacturing. He previously created Printcraft and Smartdesk

Alina Costache - CMO & Investment

Alina is a branding & communications specialist. She founded and runs Odyssey PR, a boutique consultancy in London advising clients on strategy & positioning.

Sergio​ ​Martinez - Lead Engineer

Sergio is a serial CTO and highly skilled software and hardware developer. Previously at FlickTek, he was a senior architect/engineer at Intel, Blinkx & Autonomy

Juan Esteban Paz - Engineer

Juan is a Mechatronic Engineer with extensive experience in farming and automatated systems for handling crops.

Research Partners

Earth Rover has close working relationships with the UK's leading experts in the fields of Autonomous Robotics, Precision Farming systems and innovative Organic Farming.

National Centre for Precision Farming at Harper Adams is the UK's leading research centre robotic and presision farming. We’re collaborating with and advised by: Professor Simon Blackmore, Head of Robotic Agriculture, and Sam Wane, Senior Lecturer in Mechatronics and Robotics.

We’re working with the space engineers at the Rutherford Appleton Laboratory's Autonomous Systems Group, who designed the ExoMars Rover’s autonomous driving systems and have adapted it for agricultural use as Earth Rover: Aron Kisdi, Senior Space Systems Engineer Wayne Tubby, Lead Robotics Hardware Engineer.

We're working closely with Polybell Farms, who are one of the UK's largest Organic Farmers and pioneers of the application of innovative technology to crop management.

Investors

Post Urban Ventures is a Midlands-based startup incubator, focused on hard-tech and artificial intelligence, that collaborates with some of the UK's leading research instituions.

Part of a Europe-wide network, the ESA Business Incubation Centre (BIC) Harwell provides the support that start-ups and research teams need to turn technologies designed to advance space exploration into profitable products and services for non-space markets.

Location

We're a UK company based in the Rutherford Appleton Laboratory Harwell Campus in Oxfordshire.
